review.title: Nice Hotel in Union Square
review.reviewText: The hotel was really nice with friendly employees and great food. The Bartenders Lewis and Chris were fun to talk to and knowledgeable about the area. Overall a great experience.

review.title: Great location, lovely bar, and helpful staff
review.reviewText: Had a very enjoyable stay. Staff were excellent and room was perfect.
review.positiveRemarks: Very clean and comfortable. Well located for shops and attractions. Great bar with excellent staff. Very nice enjoyable stay.

review.title: graet place
review.reviewText: overall was very good!! great , convenient location in  a heart of san francisco, very clean, staff very helpful!
review.positiveRemarks: location, staff
review.negativeRemarks: bads
review.locationRemarks: great!!

review.title: Boutique hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Cute boutique hotel in walking distance to Union Square. Enjoyed our stay and thought the hotel staff was excellent.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: It was a great stay.  But it was right out side the tenderloin district, We did not know.  Staff was super friendly.  The restaurant on property was quite small. Complimentary coffee and tea in the lobby. Amenities were upgraded from an older hotel.  We would stay again if we returned to SF.
review.positiveRemarks: Upgraded amenities, was fairly clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Lobby Bar open all day.
review.locationRemarks: Everything seemed to be in walking distance.  Walgreens, food, convenience stores.

review.title: 3rd rate stay...
review.reviewText: We were treated "less than" simply because I booked us thru a 3rd party rather than direct with Marriott. I haven't experienced this horrible of service at any other Marriott location.

review.title: Walking distance to Union Square
review.reviewText:
this is an excellent hotel near to Union Square and all of the shopping and sightseeing activities you could want.

Food is excellent, as well as all of the facilities.  Employees were very helpful with directions and ideas for dinner.
review.positiveRemarks: Closeness to Union Square and that it isn't a huge chain.
review.negativeRemarks: Room service could be extended to lunch as well.  We arrived when we needed lunch and couldn't get it.
review.locationRemarks: close to shopping...Saks, Macys Nordstroms...Close to places that provide tours, cable cars and Chinatown. Lots of places to eat as well.

review.title: Cool hotel, staff was friendly, and accommodating
review.reviewText: Clean rooms. And quite place, good job on their recent remodel.

photos.caption: View from 11th floor w super noisy bar below
Horrible views into other guests rooms

review.title: Not worth the price at all
review.reviewText: Hardly worth $250, everything was dusty and cheaply made. No special services or amenities, staff is mediocre.

review.title: Not what you will expect for an Autograph hotel
review.reviewText:
The location is little off of Union Square. That extra block or two kind of make a difference, and the price does not shows it.
Breakfast is good. Expensive as you might image. The other "restaurant", which clearly is not, may be acounted as a lobby bar. Small.
Parking is waaaaay expensive. 

Rooms are just OK. Big but layout is not roomy. The bathrooms ae kind of small.

I could see some hotels more appealing than this one. Nicer lobbies, closer, with dinner or other food alternatives.

No much to say about it.

review.title: Not the 'boutique' we expected
review.reviewText: Our experience was disappointing, the reception area was nice the room we had though large felt like it was cheaply tarted up with a lick of paint and new carpet. The bathroom was bland and felt like a motel experience. Everyday we had to call down to request coffee or mugs or for our rubbish to be removed. We also had to request the torn bed sheets that we had been given be replaced. Delighted to move out to another hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Standards of care and attention to detail. Basic room preparation.

review.title: Great Location- Excelllent staff!
review.reviewText: Hotel was within walking distance to Union Square which has a lot of shopping and restaurants. Very convenient to get around town. Staff was excellent very attentive to needs and accommodating. Highly recommend!

review.title: Nice staff... some bad luck
review.reviewText: We arrived at 4, an hour ofter the rooms were supposed to be ready.  The room wasn't ready and they offered to store our luggage and then move it into the room (once available) while we were at dinner.  We arrived 4 hours later and had the room but no luggage.  We called and the luggage took another 45 minutes to be delivered.  The kids were falling asleep while we continued to wait.  When we woke up the next morning, we realized there were only 2 towels for the 4 of us.  Aside from these things, the staff was exceptionally courteous to us and we enjoyed our stay.  Probably just a fluke!
review.positiveRemarks: Style and location.  Mariana was exceptional in providing all of the help we needed.  It was unfortunate that the ball was dropped on the luggage.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking is confusing.  There is a garage under the hotel wasn't part of the package we purchased.  It was confusing because the lot was next door.
review.locationRemarks: Cliff House down the street all the way to the ocean!

review.title: Near to Most Attractions
review.reviewText: Check in was fine.  They had quick, efficient people.  The rugs were filthy and our feet got dirty walking on it.   One of the mattresses was very old and slopped to one side so you felt like you were falling off.  The shower was so weak it was difficult to get the soap off and the bath tub was old, scratched and in need of resurfacing.  In short I would not recommend this hotel.  There are no ice machines so if you want ice you need call them and have it brought to the room.   The paint in our room was old and peeling in spots but you could see it had been repainted several times.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was ok
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms are in need of renovation
review.locationRemarks: Location is good.  3 blocks to Union Square and the cable car to the wharf.  Walking distance to Chinatown.

review.title: Nice hotel very convenient for Union Square
review.reviewText:
We stayed 3 nights. It was good. We had asked for a high floor room - this was not provided which was a pity.
The staff were very helpful although the concierge did not seem all that knowledgeable of the local area.
review.positiveRemarks: We had a free breakfast
review.negativeRemarks: The internet should be included in the cost of the room
review.locationRemarks:
Obviously near Union Square - lots to do nearby. 
Rather a lot of homeless people in the area which was a bit off-putting but beyond hotel control.

review.reviewText: Largely very satisfactory experience.  Pleasant, helpful service, spacious, comfortable and well-appointed room.  Thorough facilities and amenities.  Two complaints:   At a facility of such quality and price, there should be no charge for in-room WIFI and no charge for business center use.  These shortcomings are mostly obviated by the use of a personal iPhone WIFI hotspot and personal tablet, but they're still somewhat unwelcoming.

review.title: Amaizng
review.reviewText: We will be staying at this hotel on every trip to SF. It was great. Being in the eye of the public it was great to have such a private space and really nice staff. Rooms were great. Compared to the rest of hotels in SF. 5 stars in every aspect..

review.title: San fean
review.reviewText:
The hotel is very old and there were a lot of homeless begging for money. The hotel parking was valet only and charged $53.00 to park each night. No coffee in the room and the food was terrible.
Would never stay that hotel again

review.title: You do not want a room ending in -00!!!
review.reviewText: We stayed in room 1100. This room shares a wall with the elevators. You could hear the elevator going up and down ALL NIGHT LONG!!! When we requested to move, they told us there were no rooms available to move and the staff was not helpful. I understand if there really were no rooms available, but they could have doing something besides saying "Sorry" and leaving it at that. I was expecting more out of a hotel when you pay that much a night to stay there.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the decor.
review.negativeRemarks: Noises from the elevator and friendlier staff.
review.locationRemarks: Go Cart tours through the city and biking around the city (both have locations in Union Square.)

review.title: make new friends
review.reviewText: Many people stay there for one week or more working in the city, each night at the bar/restaurant it was like seeing family so fun.  People from all over the world there as well.  Bartender Sacred the best.  Food was just really good and fresh
Booked a room for four people, only two sets of towels, glasses etc. found a cockroach in room!! Glasses were still dirty and not changed after two days!!

review.title: good location and comfortable
review.reviewText: The fan in the bathroom didn't word. Got stuck in a broken elevator.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, room size and comfortable beds.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff seemed inexperienced.
review.locationRemarks: Location is close to great restaurants and shopping.

review.reviewText: Native San Franciscan booked a room for the night to avoid having to drive around while partying with friends. Nice little hotel conveniently located in the middle of the city. Close by pretty much anything you can want, shopping, nightlife, restaurants. The rooms were very cute and clean. Bed was comfy. The only thing that was a downside was the noise. You can hear people walking by, doors open and close, and the AC had this constant clicking sound which can be annoying if you're a light sleeper like me. Otherwise everything else was great and enjoyable.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, convenient location, beautiful spacious room.
review.negativeRemarks: It was a little bit noisy.
review.locationRemarks: Central location to downtown SF. Close to shopping, restaurants and nightlife.

review.title: Nice hotel, good location close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Visited San Fran for 4 nights on a 'girls trip' with eight women. The hotel is well located, a few blocks from Union Square. Although a bit of a hike, we were able to walk to the pier for our Alcatraz tour. The hotel staff were excellent, consistently friendly and helpful (ie: requests for extra towels, ice, help operating the iPod speaker, etc). There is a great lounge/bar across the street called Swigs. My only compliant is that you could hear significant noise from the street from our second floor room. Overall very good experience, we would stay at Hotel Adagio again.

review.title: Lovely hotel in central location.
review.reviewText:
Had a wonderful stay at Hotel Adagio for 4 nights. The room was well appointed and clean. The only minor complaint is that the bathroom is on the smaller side and I wish the air-conditioner worked better - it could have been colder. However, the staff is suburb and very accommodating. The location is in 5 min walking distance to all the major shops.

If you can, have breakfast downstairs in the restaurant because the food is wonderful! The chocolate chip pancakes are to die for!!! It's like a dutch baby but with tons of chocolate.

The hotel provides hot coffee and tea downstairs in the lobby at all hours of day which is a nice touch!

Also, for convenience sake, there is a Walgreens right around the corner, a great liquor/convenience store and a greasy spoon that serves breakfast all day, directly across the street from the hotel. The menu is enormous and so are the portions.
review.positiveRemarks:
Great staff
Convenient location
Well appointed room
Coffee/tea bar in the lobby
Great little restaurant
review.negativeRemarks: The air-conditioning could have been colder.
review.locationRemarks:
Shopping
Most places are reachable by taxi in about 10 minutes

review.reviewText: Great experience. Warm welcome on arrival. Very polite and courteous staff.

review.title: In theater district, excellent location
review.reviewText: The rooms are modern and we had a fabulous experience. The Adagio is 2.5 blocks from Union Square, smack in the middle of the theater district. It is surrounded by dozens of restaurants, clubs, and other hotels. Great location! If you wander two blocks over you hit the Tenderloin district with a large homeless population - best if you don't go there unknowingly. We initially had a single queen room but all single queen rooms are next to the loud elevator. If you are a light sleeper you may want to take that into consideration. We asked if it was possible to move us and they were incredibly helpful and managed to find us a new room.
review.positiveRemarks: Location! And the daily flavored water - cucumber, apple, orange...- that they set out for guests in the lobby.
review.locationRemarks: Great bar/restaurant just next door and tons of places to eat within a few steps.

review.title: Close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Hotel is comfortable, but not luxurious. Basic restaurant serves good breakfast with reasonable variety of choices. Lunch/dinner room service menus are unexciting. Bar is small but functional.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and comfort level; clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Uprgraded restaurant and expanded bar area would make hotel more appealing.
review.locationRemarks: 3 blks to Union Sq. 20 min walk from Moscone Center. Immediate (10 blk) vicinity teeming with homeless panhandlers (though polite & non-aggressive).

review.reviewText: Bed was not comfortable! It was not a traditional Marriot mattress

review.title: Great location in Union Square
review.reviewText: Hotel located within walking distance of restaurants, bars and shopping in Union Square.  Will come back to this hotel.

review.title: Affordable hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Friendly staff, close to restaurants and shopping. Rooms look like they have been recently renovated.
Good overall experience. Nice hotel and close to Union Square for shopping.

review.title: Sf union square
review.reviewText: Great location in union square. Rigt next to all the shopping and a couple blocks from the metro and cable cars. A great brunch place is right next door too

review.title: Nice hotel , close to Union Square
review.reviewText: When we checked in at 3pm we were told the room was not ready yet. We were asked to have a seat it would only be a moment.  Twenty minutes later I looked for the young lady who had helped us and discovered she had gone off duty. I asked about our room and was told it was ready. We were left sitting there.

review.title: Wonderful staff.  Extremely friendly and helpful.
review.reviewText: The room was spacious, and the bed was very comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: One of the loveliest things was having tea and coffee in the lobby.
review.negativeRemarks: Can't think of a thing!
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location and easy access to all SF has to offer.

review.title: Great room near Union Square
review.reviewText: Loved the hotel.  Easy walk to Union Square with lots of restaurants in the area.

review.title: Very Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Enjoyable stay. Reasonably priced in comparison to other options.
review.positiveRemarks: Good size rooms, good location (though close to the rough part of town if you take a wrong turn), nice bar in the lobby with v. friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Wireless free in the lobby, but free wireless in the rooms would be a great improvement.
review.locationRemarks: Good location - 2 blocks from Union Square and the cable cars. Half way between AT&T Stadium (Giants Baseball) and Fisherman's Wharf. So ideal.

review.title:
Girl 
Trip
review.reviewText: We found the service at this HOTEL excellent.  From our first step out of the cab to the day we left, we were well looked after  The concierge was fabulous.  From Sam to Mose, and the girl's at the front desk, we were very impressed with the service. This Hotel was close to everywhere we had to go.  Would definitely recommend.
review.positiveRemarks: Location. Comfortable Beds and Pillows.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping/Dining/Baseball/Theatres/Cable Cars/Street Cars.

review.reviewText: I didn't enjoy my experience here. The concierge was a guy that the front desk lady asked a bellman to do and his suggestion the entire time was to speak to the hotel at our next stop about questions rather than trying to help us out and look up information for us. If I wanted our next hotel to look up information I would have done it anyways but I wanted their insight. Definitely not professional. The room was very dark, I don't know why people are getting cheap on lighting nowadays. There were 2 sidetable lamps and that's it. The bathroom looks pretty old and the shower pressure wasn't great.
review.positiveRemarks: The breakfast was very good and the bar was nice but not as over the top as the website portrays it to be.
review.locationRemarks: Location is very good, 3-4 blocks from union square.

review.title: Great, clean hotel. Big room, no noise, no issues.
review.reviewText: Searched for ages trying to find the right hotel as San Fran as it is pretty expensive, so was very pleased when we got there and saw the amount we paid was worth it (and it wasn't the most expensive). Really great, modern hotel right in the centre of town. Can get everywhere easily. I mean San Fran is pretty easy to get around anyway to be honest! No issues, great staff, clean, modern, value for money. One drawback is up there are a few streets with some slight sad looking people, bit confronting, but I guess it happens everywhere right? Book it, you won't be disappointed.
Clean, very attractive decor, modern large bathroom and large comfortable room.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel, comes up short on amenities
review.reviewText: Beautiful room. Extremely comfortable bed. Would stay here again. We were disappointed in room service: food was average, and they didn't get our order right. Also, room service did not provide a table, so we ended up eating from our laps in bed. Our other disappointment was with the bellhop and valet parking One gentleman in valet parking provided excellent customer service, but the others did not provide good service. They would yell at each other. Did not inspire confidence in leaving our car with them. If you don't care about room service and rude valet parking technicians, we would highly recommend this hotel. Hotel staff were very helpful and most accommodating. Very beautiful room.
review.positiveRemarks: Beautiful accommodations. Very unique. You won't find such nicely appointed rooms at the chain hotels. Bed was the most comfortable bed ever.
review.negativeRemarks: Extend hours for your room service. Improve food quality. Provide a portable table for us to eat on. Improve customer service for valet parking.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to Union Square. Metro and Muni a block away. 15 minute bus ride to AT&T Park for all you Giants fans out there.

review.title: San Francisco stop en route to Sonoma.
review.reviewText:
I go to Sonoma every April for a wine event. I book end my stay in SF , as I used to live there and love to visit my old town. I stay on Geary - either at the Adagio or the Monaco. This time, I booked the Adagio, which was recently taken over by Marriott , as a boutique hotel. Rates went up a bit , the facility looks much better, rooms refreshed, but there are some things that they could improve.

The rooms are nice , spacious. I asked them to check my old ' preferences' but those were lost during transition.
Lovely water with fruit in lobby!
No real concierge, but a nice bar and sitting area. Coffee in the morning complimentary.. but it was weak ( yes.. we love our coffee). Also, we had a problem with sour 1/2 and 1/2 that we had to point out to the coffee staff. Really , sour cream? Yuk!

The room was comfortable. But the bath needs improvement. No place to put anything. Dryer not good for ' real' hair drying or styling. And that darn fan. Women need to use a mirror to put on makeup, do hair. Bath fan off.. not an option.. so annoying. Same with trying to quietly slip in late at night while spouse is sleeping. Separately switch the fan please!!!
I hope that Marriott gets the fine details nailed soon. No shower cap. Noisy fan, sour 1/2 and 1/2 with the coffee.. and .. maybe stronger or a better grind of coffee would be nice?
I will return.. as it's convenient .
review.positiveRemarks: Location is great. We love the parking situation, as it's convenient. Easy to walk most everywhere , including Union Square for shopping.
review.negativeRemarks: I hate the bathroom! Fan stays on all the time , which drives me crazy! As a woman, I need a close up mirror to hair and makeup. The fan is noisy !
review.locationRemarks: Union Square,Polk Street, Upper Fillmore shopping .. all pretty close by. Walk to Chinatown, Financial District or to North Beach. Shop and eat!

review.title: Nice modern hotel
review.reviewText:
The hotel was very nice. The room was either very new or remodeled.
I didn't like the free wifi was only in the lobby, but you could take there complementary coffee.
It's well located, but there are a couple of streets nearby to avoid at night.
I would recommend this Hotel (especially if you can get it for 99$+tax or cheaper).

review.title: Excellent location, friendly staff, nice big room
review.reviewText: It was difficult choosing from the many hotels available in San Francisco but we're sure glad we picked this one. Everything about the hotel worked great from the location to the room size and even the large pitcher of water with ice and sliced fruit that was set out in the lobby every day. The concierge helped us with a car rental and tickets for the open-top bus tour. The staff was friendly and smiling. We'll stay there again if we get a chance to go back to San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything!!
review.locationRemarks: Very close to union square and Chinatown.

review.title: A wonderful surprise
review.reviewText: Our drive to the hotel had us skeptical of our choice but from the moment we walked in, our concerns were gone! The staff is young, friendly, enthusiastic, polite, efficient....can't find enough positive adjectives!! We stayed for 3 days and did not encounter one negative person! The room was spacious, well appointedadnd clean. The only negative would be the close view of the rather shady apartment building across the alley. Close the curtains and it was all good! Highly recommend staying here.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff
review.negativeRemarks: More parking options
review.locationRemarks: Located very near the shopping area, China town and the Trolley. Also near the Tenderloin district.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Free Wifi in the lobby area with tea and coffee 24/7

review.title: Best bargain, by far, in the Union Square vicinity
review.reviewText: Classy hotel for an unbelievably reasonable price, considering location near Union Square. Staff very friendly and helpful. Bar is nice, but appetizers are over-priced. Example: We ordered pork belly" plate over rice for $8. What we received was about 4 inches (sliced in 2 inch pieces) of thick-sliced bacon. Recommendation: Eat somewhere else.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, lobby ambience, friendly staff, and room condition.
review.negativeRemarks: Inform guests, in advance, that valet parking charge is $55.00 (tax included). Parking is also available for less cost in public garages.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of great restaurants and entertainment available within walking distance. For example, ACT and Curran Theaters, as well as Biscuits and Blues.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for your review - I'm glad that you enjoyed our staff and stay. Overall parking in the San Francisco area varies from $35-$65 just within a block radius of our location. We hope that you enjoyed every minute of your visit and we hope to see you again soon!

Warm Regards,
Michael Pace
General Manager

review.title: Great hotel but Valet parking was way too much.
review.reviewText: Hotel was very nice and clean. The decor was up to date, staff was very friend. Walking distance to union square, restaurants, malls and bars. The only problem was the parking, we did valet parking and it was 49 dollars a day plus tax. The moated I've ever paid for parking.
review.positiveRemarks: Walking distance to everything in downtown SF
review.negativeRemarks: Wish parking wasn't

review.title: Beautiful, modern, hip hotel nearby Union Square
review.reviewText: This is a beautiful hotel nearby Union Square. In terms of location, it is borderline tenderloin so be prepared for less than luxe surroundings. However, if you are an San Francisco resident like myself, this is not really bothersome. The design of the hotel is very modern and hip. The hotel staff were incredibly accommodating. Given that this is a boutique-style hotel, it is on the smaller side, i.e. the hallways are very narrow. The design of the room was consistent with the rest of the hotel and was plenty spacious for our short stay. One main drawback was the lack of insulation in the windows. We stayed on St. Patty's weekend, so it was very noisy outside and this felt amplified in the room.
review.positiveRemarks: Design
review.negativeRemarks: Insulation of windows
review.locationRemarks: Shopping and dining in Union Square

managementResponses.response:
Thanks Dave for the lovely 4-star review - I will make sure that the staff knows what a great impression they made!

Regards,
Michael Pace
General Manager

review.title: Fantastic location
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. Can't beat the location. Surrounded by bars/restaurants and about a 5 min walk from Powell St. BART station. Friendly staff and cozy bar.

managementResponses.response:
Thanks so much for the 5-star review!

We're looking forward to your next trip!

Warm Regards,
Michael Pace
General Manager

review.title: great!
review.reviewText:
brand new, spacious room, walking distance from city center
friendly staff
safe area (limits, do not explore west from hotel)

managementResponses.response:
Thanks for the 4-star rating! We're glad that you enjoyed our infused water in the lobby.

Warm Regards,
Michael Pace
General Manager

review.title: Comfortable and convenient for travelers
review.reviewText: This hotel is in the union squire, it is very convenient to go to other scenic spots. We booked the King bed, but the room is small and there's no drink water in the room. Only in lobby can we drink free water.
review.negativeRemarks: Why not provide free clean water in rooms for customers to drink?

managementResponses.response:
Dear Jason,
Thank you for your feedback. We like to hear the areas in which we can improve upon. We're very glad that you were comfortable and our staff was friendly during your visit.

We look forward to serving you in the future.

review.title: Not bad, but there are better options in SF.
review.reviewText: A little pricey for its location. Staff was very nice though and we were comfortable.

managementResponses.response:
Thanks for the 4-star rating! We're so glad that our hotel worked for you!

Michael Pace
General Manager

review.negativeRemarks: on of the staff members was very condescending
review.locationRemarks: Close to union square

managementResponses.response:
Thanks for the 4-star rating! We're so glad that our hotel worked for you!

Michael Pace
General Manager

review.title: Excellent hotel Nice location. Very beautiful room

managementResponses.response: Thank you for deciding to give us the opportunity to accommodate you. We certainly appreciate such a high rating, especially from such an avid traveler as yourself. It's exciting for us to hear that you would stay with us again, and we hope it will be in the very near future.

review.title: Nice hotel very friendly staff.
review.reviewText: Booked this hotel on a non published price so we did not know what we were getting. I travel extensively and have stayed at many hotels in S.F. This is a definite 4 star. Very clean comfortable and fresh. Would repeat

managementResponses.response: We are very sorry to hear that your stay failed to fit your preference. Your comments and suggestions on our room layout, bathroom door in your room and the hair dryer have been taken seriously, and we regret not having the opportunity to make things rights while you were here with us. Please know that we would have been more than happy to relocate you into another room so that the proper attention could have been given to our shortcomings in your room. Thank you for bringing these details to our attention by completing the review. Your comfort is truly our top priority. We hope to have another chance to prove this to you.

review.title: Small Room
review.reviewText:
We stay in SF often, and this hotel was not up to standards. The room layout was not comfortable (easy to fix) - it was very narrow to get to the other side of the bed, the closet didn't hold your luggage rack so you have to move around the narrow passage to get to your luggage.
Also the bathroom door was very difficult to close and had black scraping marks on it.
Lastly, the room didn't have a hair dryer (this can happen). When the staff brought one up, I was a bit put off as I was in my pj top on, and though the man was nice, he came in the room and wanted to make sure that we didn't already have a hair dryer in the room. Note that the dryer that was brought up had the on/off switch and the air control broken off.
review.positiveRemarks: The front desk staff was very pleasant when we check in
review.locationRemarks: very close to Union Square, but also close to the Tenderloin where people live on the streets and aggressively ask for money

managementResponses.response: Thank you for letting us and others know that your stay at Hotel Adagio was perfect for your family of four! As you mentioned, our staff is dedicated to serving and paying very close attention to every detail to ensure our guests' enjoyment. Thank you for also sharing that you enjoyed our complimentary amenities, fitness center and of course, our chic cocktail lounge, The Mortimer. We are very excited to hear that we have earned your guest loyalty and recommendation of our property to others. It will truly be a pleasure for all of us to have you as our guests again!

review.title: Perfect for our family of 4
review.reviewText: From the very helpful and informative pre-visit call to Scott, the concierge, our stay was exceptional! I found this hotel on-line and decided to risk a site-unseen stay. We had a wonderful greeting and exemplary care from the concierge and the front desk. Our room was perfect for my family of 4, it had a king size bed and a pull-out sofa for my kids, which is hard to find in the city! Attention to detail with fresh fruit water in the lobby, FREE Starbucks's all day and fresh hot cookies in the evening! The fitness center was well appointed and clean and the restaurant/bar in the lobby was perfect....food, wine, bar servers all excellent! I will recommend this hotel and stay every time I come to the city. Great job by all!
review.positiveRemarks: The boutique feel with all of the amenities of a large chain hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: The air conditioner in my room was either turning off automatically or the maid turned it off during service. I would've preferred it left on.
review.locationRemarks: Just off Union Square it was centrally located to shopping, restaurants or a cable car ride down to the wharf.

managementResponses.response: We are, indeed, right in the heart of all of the San Francisco action! Thank you for sharing that our location is amazing and within walking distance to the San Francisco attractions and all the different modes of transportation. It's great to hear that you enjoyed a nice stay with us while visiting California. We appreciate your review and high rating.

review.title: Right in the center of all the action.
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. Walking distance from Union Square and easy to get to all the different mode of transportation.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was very helpful in providing information about things to do and the best mode of transportation to get there.
review.negativeRemarks: They only had 2 elevators, and when the hotel was busy it took a long time to get on them.
review.locationRemarks: 2 blocks from Union Square and the Mall. Good breakfast diner across the street, for a really good price.

review.title: Good location and staff, lousy room/view.
review.reviewText: My wife and I stayed here for our one year wedding anniversary and the staff did nothing to make it special in anyway. Our room was tiny, dirty and had a view of an alley and the restaraunt grease duct. The front desk/concierge were horrible, but the restaraunt/bar/doormen were great. Stay here for the location and bar/restaraunt staff. If you want a special get away, stay somewhere else.
review.negativeRemarks: Room was not very clean and needs improvment in this area.
review.locationRemarks: Great location.

review.title: Nice place
review.reviewText: This is a nice hotel, with its helpful staff as one of thier important assets. Nice little lounge, room with complimentary coffee and tea. Two or three blocks from union square. Still have the confidence in their guests to have a full minibar in your room. Always staff there 24/7 to welcome and check in the lobby. Travelers should note that the picture of a rooftop dinner place should not be mistaken for the hotel as there are no rooftop terrace/bar in this facility. Also, this location is perhaps 1-2 streets north of the Tenderloin area... a not so much reputable area. However, as you stay longer in the city, you realize there is a lot of not so much reputable areas... and you go with the flow.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff
review.negativeRemarks: No complimentary internet. The "boutique hotel" concept ought to be interpreted as: you have a minibar in your room.
review.locationRemarks: North of Tenderloin area, affectuously called "tenderland" by our cab driver.

review.title: Decent rooms - Bad Location
review.reviewText:
The hotel itself was very nice but the lighting in the rooms is very bad. They are using 25 watt flourescent bulbs in all the lamps so reading is difficult and for the ladies, putting on makeup is a problem.

The location is convenient to Union Square and the cable cars but also seems to be the location of choice for several hundred homeless people. They bother everyone 24 hours a day. Safety could be an issue. The police don't seem to do anything about this problem and are rarely seen in this area.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean and neat.
review.negativeRemarks: Lighting.
review.locationRemarks: The location is convenient to Union Square and the cable cars but also seems to be the location of choice for several hundred homeless people. They bo

review.title: Gorgeous hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is gorgeous and the staff very friendly. I didn't try the restaurants but made use of their athletic facilities which were very much appreciated.

review.title: Adagio and surrounding areas
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Adagio in late April 2013. We found the location excellent and very central to Union Square. The staff were very helpful and we had requested a quieter room away from the front of the hotel and this was organised. There was an excellent Thai resturant two blocks further away from the Adagio and any number of choices of places to eat on either side of the street heading down to Union Square. We loved all the art galleries on Geary St and the square was buzzing with all sorts of entertainment and activities. We had tickets for the City sightseeing hop on and hop off bus tour. We were very impressed when they told us they had a shuttle to their office some blocks away to collect the actuall tickets to do the tour. San francisco is a very "walker friendly" city. Alcatraz was also very interesting and thought provoking. We walked up to the Coit Tower through China town and little Italy. Very interesting and quite doable on our last morning with 3 hours to fill.
review.positiveRemarks: Our room had two double beds and plenty of room which makes it easier when travelling with a teenager

review.title: Beautiful, clean, and comfortable rooms
review.reviewText: My entire family LOVED our room in the Hotel Adagio. The decor was beautiful, stay-friendly, and relaxing. Lots of natural lighting and, yes, VERY CLEAN. The free coffee/tea and fruit-infused water 24/7 was an excellent touch. Highly recommend. It was so nice my friend canceled her room at a shabby hotel a few blocks away to join us in another beautiful room at the Hotel Adagio. :)

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: GREAT location if you want to be right near Union Square! So convenient to shopping, plays, and restaurants! Seems like they took an old hotel and made it modern. Contemporary feel and very pleasant!
review.positiveRemarks: Excellent Location
review.locationRemarks: right near everything you'd want to be near!

review.title: Very good value and location
review.reviewText: Nice place, nice staff, great central location. Would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Great value boutique hotel
review.reviewText:
This hotel is a centrally located gem. Within walking disctance to Union Square, Chinatown, shopping and on the bus line to many attractions. On the days we decided to take a cab, the doorman was nice enough to hail it for us. We decided against renting a car and found that to be the best option, parking here isn't cheap and public transportation is pretty reliable. Staff at the front desk were very helpful with questions about how to navigate the city.

We were disappointed at the lack of continential breakfast but it seems this is not out of the ordinary for San Francisco hotels. There are plenty of delicious coffee shops for breakfst in the area. We did take full advantage of the free tea and cofee in the lobby. There was also fresh water in the lobby with nice fresh fruit soaking in for a water bottle fillup on the way out or a nice refeshing glass after a long day of walking.

The room was pretty spacious and clean. Sharing a hotel room with two other women, we had enough space to spread our things arround without feeling cramped. We were on the six floor with a window view of the parking lot, but honestly we spent more time exploring the city so the lack of a breathtaking city view didnt take away from our stay. There are several hotels in the area where you can go to get the penthouse view your looking for. The room was fashioned with a modern feel.

I will definitely return to this hotel on my next trip to San Fran!
review.positiveRemarks: Free gym and large room.
review.negativeRemarks: No continential breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: In the union square area. Great location.

review.title: Good value for great location
review.reviewText: We had a good experience at the Adagio. Good value for a boutique-styled hotel. The staff were very helpful and appeared to enjoy working in the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.negativeRemarks: It seemed that there was a higher percentage of homeless / panhandler / crazy people in the vicinity of this hotel than in immediately adjacent areas
review.locationRemarks: a few blocks from Union Square

review.title: Great Location and Staff
review.reviewText: Really enjoyed the friendly and accommodating staff. They recommended great places to eat, were quick to fulfill special requests and always friendly and welcoming.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was great for access to everything we wanted.

review.title: Great hotel for family, girls getaways and busines
review.reviewText: Great property. Large rooms and very clean. Excellent and fast service at the front desk and bellman. Issues with loud noise coming from another room one evening and security was up to knock on their door in less than 2 minutes. We would definitely stay here again!
review.positiveRemarks: Large room which is difficult to find in SF!

review.title: Thank you for a very nice stay.
review.reviewText:
We were very pleased with our room. We occupied a room across from the elevator and close to the street. We were very grateful how quiet the room was and pleased that the windows opened for fresh air. A safe in the room is a plus as well as a couch for seating. The bed and pillows provided a very good nights sleep. The only negative comment we had was that the couch was situated where you could not see the television. We had to sit on the bed to view the television. If you would like ice, you will need to have it delivered. We thought it was a bit odd that every day our glasses were replaced with only one glass. There were two of us. Coffee and tea are available on the main floor 24 hours a day. Thank you for that service.
For San Francisco, this room was a very good size space. We will definitely stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice room
review.negativeRemarks: Television not visable from couch seating area.
review.locationRemarks: Great location to Union Square

review.title: Fantastic
review.reviewText:
Fantastic central location, definitely be back!
Welcoming staff, safe area to be out and about with kids
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.locationRemarks: Great spot very central - very safe area
